Container.Description: The aim for this project is to create the worlds best and hottest interface to interact with aria2. aria2 is the worlds best file downloader, but sometimes the command line brings more power than necessary. The project was initially created as part of the GSOC scheme, however it has rapidly grown and changed with tremendous support and feedback from the aria2 community. [br/] [b]Instructions:[/b][br/] Set Port to the port you want to be able to access from. Defaults to 6880[br/] Set Mount Points for the downloads directory and the watch directory.[br/] [br/] After the first start you need to add your HOST, RPC-Port and SECRET code in the connection settings of the webUI (Settings -> Connection Settings).

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Concurrent Downloads
Config.Description: Set the maximum number of parallel downloads for every queue item.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Seed Ratio
Config.Description: pecify share ratio. Seed completed torrents until share ratio reaches RATIO. You are strongly encouraged to specify equals or more than 1.0 here. Specify 0.0 if you intend to do seeding regardless of share ratio. If --seed-time option is specified along with this option, seeding ends when at least one of the conditions is satisfied.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Seed Time
Config.Description: Specify seeding time in (fractional) minutes. Also see the --seed-ratio option.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Disable IPv6
Config.Description: This is useful if you have to use broken DNS and want to avoid terribly slow AAAA record lookup.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Force Save
Config.Description: Save download with --save-session option even if the download is completed or removed. This option also saves control file in that situations. This may be useful to save BitTorrent seeding which is recognized as completed state.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Download Limit
Config.Description: Set max download speed per each download in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted. You can append K or M (1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). To limit the overall download speed, use --max-overall-download-limit.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Overall Download Limit
Config.Description: Set max overall download speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted. You can append K or M (1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). To limit the download speed per download, use --max-download-limit option.
